TRUMP HUSH MONEY Verdict

Trump guilty on all counts

Historic verdict on 34 felony counts in scheme to illegally influence 2016 election
He faces a maximum sentence of 1⅓ to four years in prison after being deemed a felon in New York. Sentencing is set for July 11 — just days before the Republican National Convention, where Trump, the only former U.S. president convicted of a crime, is set to be formally nominated for president by his party.
By Shayna Jacobs, Devlin Barrett, Derek Hawkins and Mark Berman
